intro: Taraxacum pycnodon, commonly known as the densehead dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its tightly packed, dark green leaves and a flowering head that produces a cluster of small, yellow flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in a variety of soil types, including sandy and loamy soils. It is often found in meadows, lawns, and disturbed areas, where it can spread rapidly through its extensive root system. The plant's common name refers to the dense, compact arrangement of its flower heads.
